body:
Same here

_Edit by maintainer bot: Comment was **automatically** minimized because it was considered unhelpful. (If you think this was by mistake, let us know). Please only comment if it adds context to the issue. If you want to express that you have the same problem, use the upvote üëç on the issue description or subscribe to the issue for updates. Thanks!_

Hi,

Edit: `let me review with more detail what happened here`

Meanwhile: Change your config to something like - https://nextjs.org/docs/app/api-reference/config/eslint#setup-eslint:

```js
import { defineConfig, globalIgnores } from 'eslint/config'
import nextVitals from 'eslint-config-next/core-web-vitals'
 
const eslintConfig = defineConfig([
  ...nextVitals,
  // Override default ignores of eslint-config-next.
  globalIgnores([
    // Default ignores of eslint-config-next:
    '.next/**',
    'out/**',
    'build/**',
    'next-env.d.ts',
  ]),
])
 
export default eslintConfig
```

Edit2: 

You have to run `npx @next/codemod@latest next-lint-to-eslint-cli .` separately, after running `npx @next/codemod@latest upgrade latest` - Notice that the options in the latter do not list the former. Gonna ask around a bit more, but the lint migration codemod should handle things. I'll update the [guide](https://nextjs.org/docs/app/guides/upgrading/version-16) w/ the info I find.

In a way it is like, migrating eslint is not part of upgrading but then the upgrade guide needs to point this out.

Same issue here since the canary releases. I thought it would be fixed in the final version, but it still isn‚Äôt. I ended up wasting a few hours debugging something so trivial...

It turned out to be caused by the `@eslint/eslintrc` package. From what I understand, Next.js changed its base configuration and `FlatCompat` is no longer needed. But since there was zero explanation from the dev team, it‚Äôs not exactly easy to guess.

I‚Äôd really like to get a proper explanation, and for it to be documented on the https://nextjs.org/blog/next-16
 page, etc.

The `npx @next/codemod@latest next-lint-to-eslint-cli .` handles this (from the little testing I've done this morning), but it is not run when doing `npx @next/codemod@latest upgrade latest` 

AFAIK there are some conditions the codemod checks for, to list what modifications it'll do, and it is not picking up the https://nextjs.org/docs/app/guides/upgrading/codemods#migrate-from-next-lint-to-eslint-cli codemod 

The https://nextjs.org/docs/app/guides/upgrading/version-16#eslint-flat-config mentions this, but not as strongly, and since the codemod to upgrade is not doing this, needs and update to mention what to do. I am still investigating though, got my hands a bit full today, but I'll try to push an update to the upgrade guide.

mmm in your case we are ending up with:

```console
   No Next.js configs found, but preserving other configs
   Preserving FlatCompat setup for other ESLint configs
‚ö†    Config does not export an array or supported pattern. Manual migration required.
   Could not automatically update the existing flat config.
   Please manually ensure your ESLint config includes the Next.js configurations
```

Let me investigate a bit more ~ I noticed the codemod from ESLint does the same ü§î 

Take this with a grain of salt, I've been context switching a lot today, and have my personal opinions on ESLint9+, but if you manually drop the `defineConfig` function, into this

```js
export default [
  { ignores: ["src/codegen/**/*", "src/codegen-pipeline/**/*",   "src/components/setup/Distros.tsx"] },
  ...compat.extends("next/core-web-vitals"), // I think the prettier compat extend can be remove here, and same with "next" and use the core-web-vitals one instead 
  {
    plugins: {
      "react-compiler": reactCompiler,
      prettier,
    },
    rules: {
      "react-compiler/react-compiler": "error",
      "prettier/prettier": "error",
    },
  },
];
```

And the codemod will be able to simplify further... but I can relate and understand that this is overwhelming.

Note that you have to manually ignore a bunch of things too, like the lint file itself

Hi @jcubic, thanks for reporting the issue. I've confirmed `npx @next/codemod next-lint-to-eslint-cli .` works for your case, your [master](https://github.com/jcubic/10xDevs/blob/db3fceb17809165e76663cb6f840dbd1dd3dc662/eslint.config.mjs) branch has correct format üëç

Hi @sovetski, sorry to hear that.. FYI, we've updated the docs about ESLint at https://nextjs.org/docs/app/api-reference/config/eslint (Thanks to @icyJoseph), so people can get more information when migrating. Feel free to let us know early or ping me if you are stuck with the migration next time. Thank you!

issue.title: [codemod] fix: next-lint-to-eslint-cli did not handle `'next'` plugin
issue.body:
Codemod `next-lint-to-eslint-cli` did not handle `extends: ['next']` in legacy ESLint config.

x-ref: https://github.com/vercel/next.js/issues/85244#issuecomment-3482558412

Fixes #85244

body:
Don't look at master branch, this is my working code, I fixed the issue long ago. There is a branch with error at:

https://github.com/jcubic/10xDevs/tree/eslint

> Don't look at master branch, this is my working code, I fixed the issue long ago. There is a branch with error at:
> 
> https://github.com/jcubic/10xDevs/tree/eslint

Yes I've ran `npx @next/codemod next-lint-to-eslint-cli .` to that branch and it did work, I thought it worked for you and pushed to `master`. Could you try again?

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/bee084fa-5a65-4acb-96db-19128e4be93a
